course.title: ADM 3360 Business Law (3 units)
course.desc: A foundation course in law that aims to introduce the student to the fundamental concepts of the common law. It comprises a study of the Canadian legal system, principles of statutory interpretation, the role of precedent in judicial decisions, the basic elements of contract law, negligence and product liability, and certain important concepts in property law such as land tenure, mortgages, landlords and tenant and personal property.Course Component: LecturePrerequisite: ADM 1100 or ADM 1300.
